txt.en: Talk to Belg Thickshanks
Grámi Hornhelm has requested that you help craft a weapon.\n\nYou should talk to Belg Thickshanks to proceed.
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should talk to Belg Thickshanks.
TBD
Weaponsmithing Like a Dwarf
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should talk to Belg Thickshanks.
Hammer the steel on the anvil
Grámi Hornhelm is grateful for your aid with the Easterlings, and has offered to give you a small taste of the dwarf craft of weaponsmithing.
Hone the blade on the grindstone
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should talk to Belg Thickshanks.
TBD
The blade is now red-hot
Heat steel in the forge
The dagger is now fully assembled!
Talk to Belg Thickshanks
The steel is red-hot and ready to be worked
Talk to Belg Thickshanks
TBD
Talk to Belg Thickshanks
TBD
The steel is now blade-shaped
Talk to Belg Thickshanks
The blade now has a sharp edge

'Since you have been so helpful, I have decided to let you assist with smithing our next shipment of weapons. Pay attention, and you might just learn something about superior dwarf craftsmanship! Speak to my assistant, Belg Thickshanks. He will show you what to do.'
'How fare you at weapon-smithing, [placeholder]? We could use another set of strong dwarf hands crafting the next shipment of weapons. Speak to Belg Thickshanks. He will assist you.'
Talk to Belg Thickshanks
'Master Grámi sent you? Excellent! You are going to help me make a dagger. I will walk you through the process. Take some steel over to the forge. First step, heating it so we can shape it.'
Re-heat the blade in the forge
Quench the blade in the water tank
Assemble the dagger at the assembly table
Talk to Grámi Hornhelm
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should use the forge to heat steel.
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should hammer the steel on the anvil to shape it.
'Now that the steel is good and hot, you can hammer it into shape. Place it on the anvil, and hammer it into a basic blade. You know what a dagger looks like, don't you?'
'Good, good, that is the right shape. Now, you need to hone an edge, or that dagger may as well be a club! Take it over to the grindstone.'
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should hone the edge of the blade on the grindstone.

'Nice and sharp? Now, we need to re-heat the metal and quickly quench it in the water tank. Why? Because right now, the blade is brittle. Wouldn't want that dagger to shatter while you're toe-to-toe with an Orc, eh?'
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should talk to Belg Thickshanks.
'Good, good. Now, all that is left is polish and assembly. Take it over to the table there. Attach the guard, grip, and pommel. And then, give that blade a good polish, so it shines like a mirror.'
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should talk to Belg Thickshanks.
TBD
You should talk to Grámi Hornhelm, who  can be found in Hammerstead.
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should re-heat the blade in the forge.

'All done? Give it here.'

Belg examines your work for any flaws.

'Not half-bad! The only thing left to do is show your work to Master Grámi. Good luck! He has very high standards.'
Grámi examines your work with a discerning eye.\n\n'I could tell you were a natural smith! Excellent work, [placeholder].'
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should quench the red-hot blade in the water tank.
Belg Thickshanks has asked you to help craft a dagger in Hammerstead.\n\nYou should assemble the dagger at the assembly table.
The blade has been cooled and hardened
Grámi examines your work with a discerning eye.\n\n'Acceptable work. We will put it with the others.'
